short_summary: provide veterinarian services at Collins Bay Institution and Joyceville Institution
description: The Correctional Service of Canada has a requirement for Veterinarian Services at Collins Bay Institution and Joyceville Institution. The objectives are to provide veterinarian services for the livestock at Joyceville and Collins Bay Institutions for livestock that is part of the CORCAN Agriculture program, including both a dairy herd and a beef herd. The deliverable will provide a mutually agreed upon  vaccination schedule, within 30 days of standing offer award, an annual vaccination schedule, a  schedule for routine herd health checks, a schedule for pregnant check for cows, provide medicines or supplies required for the treatment of the cattle, and the most current Fee Guidelines established by the Ontario Veterinary Medical Association. The work will be performed during the period of standing offer award to March 31, 2027, with the option to renew for two (2) additional one-year periods. The procurement process will be competitive.

full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Title
Veterinary Services

## Reference Number
cb-879-27934359

## Solicitation Number
21C40-23-4448497/A

## Publication Date
2024-02-01

## Tender Closing Date
2024-02-27T17:00:00

## Amendment Date
2024-02-27

## Expected Contract Start Date
2024-04-01

## Expected Contract End Date
2027-03-31

## Tender Status
Expired

## Procurement Category
SRV

## Procurement Method
Competitive - Open Bidding

## Selection Criteria
Lowest Price

## Notice Type
Request for Standing Offer

## Detailed Description
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) invites interested suppliers to submit a bid for the provision of Veterinary Services at Collins Bay Institution and Joyceville Institution. The objective of this procurement is to obtain the services of a qualified veterinarian to provide animal health care services for the livestock at the institution.

## Statement of Work
* Conduct routine herd health checks for cows
* Perform pregnancy checks for cows
* Provide medicines or supplies required for the treatment of cattle
* Provide a vaccination schedule to ensure all animals are up-to-date on their vaccinations
* Provide the most current fee guidelines established by the Ontario Veterinary Medical Association (OVMA)

## Procurement Details
* The standing offer is for a period of two (2) years, with an option to renew for two (2) additional one-year periods.
* The Contracting Authority is Sandra Wilford, who can be contacted at (604) 557-3004 or via email at Sandra.Wilford@csc-scc.gc.ca.

## Evaluation Criteria
* Price
* Qualifications of the bidder

## Submission Details
* Bidders must submit their bid in writing, clearly labeled with the solicitation number.
* Documents must be in either English or French.
* The closing date for submissions is February 27, 2024 at 17:00:00.

## Contact Information
For more information, please contact Sandra Wilford at (604) 557-3004 or Sandra.Wilford@csc-scc.gc.ca.
